dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 190 IH: Sending Evading Non-Documented Threats Home Especially Migrants Biden Accepted Carelessly and Knowingly Act of 2025
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Ogles (for himself, Mr. Biggs of Arizona, Mr. Clyde, Mr. Brecheen, Ms. Mace, and Mr. Moore of Alabama) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To provide for expedited removal of certain illegal aliens.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Sending Evading Non-Documented Threats Home Especially Migrants Biden Accepted Carelessly and Knowingly Act of 2025 or the SEND THEM BACK Act of 2025.

section.header: Expedited removal of certain illegal aliens

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, an alien who entered the United States illegally on or since January 20, 2021, shall be subject to expedited removal, even if such alien indicated an intention to apply for asylum or a fear of persecution.
Subsection (a) shall not apply to any alien who is currently a member of the Armed Forces of the United States as of January 1, 2025.
